text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Mubarak says progress on the Palestinian track will push all other tracks. President also tells news conference with the Israeli defence minister that Hebron deal would give Syria confidence to resume negotiations with Israel.
- Mubarak in phone conversations with Arafat and Netanyahu.
- President says during Hurghada tour that Sheikh Zaid lake is a very modern project.
- Egypt to launch first satellite in 1997.
- Mubarak tells news conference with Mordechai that peace is the only way and that settlements are a dangerous problem.
- Public Enterprise Minister Atef Obeid says he had successful talks with officials in Saudi Arabia.
- Mubarak tours Hurgahda and says his visit is for the benefit and comfort of Egyptians.
- Official at Public Enterprise Ministry says that sale of 28 public sector companies as part of privatisation programme has brought in 2.3 billion pounds.
- Commercial International Bank finishes study on setting up of new fertilisation firm.
- Mubarak says implemenation of agreements will lift gloom in the region.
